intro: Callista sarcantha, commonly known as the golden bell heather, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in landscape design.
